data.text:
McKinney

McKinney Homes & Real Estate

Get exclusive information about McKinney neighborhood properties, or schedule a home showing today - contact your McKinney real estate specialists now! McKinney is a charming town located only 30 miles north of the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex. This city prides itself on the small-town atmosphere it has maintained in a high-paced region. McKinney is very close to Dallas & Fort Worth and the rapid expansion of outlying areas. These factors have led to McKinney's emergence as a premier place to live and work in Texas. For more information about the McKinney area, and McKinney TX homes for sale, click here.

Want to purchase a home in McKinney? Call your McKinney real estate team, VIP Realty at 214-295-4888. Your neighborhood McKinney REALTORSÂ® and agents are here to help with the Dallas housing market.

McKinney Homes For Sale

The city of McKinney in Texas lies just 32 miles or so north of Dallas. This city is covered by the DFW metroplex, and McKinney homes for sale are thus highly sought after and widely envied for their prime location. The homes for sale in McKinney are just a couple minutes away from at least two airports, numerous public and private educational institutions, corporate offices, shopping and dining destinations, recreational facilities, and more.

Another key benefit you stand to gain from moving into McKinney is peace of mind. There is nothing like getting a sound sleep each night, knowing that your loved ones and your property are fully protected. This is why McKinney is also home to many families with senior loved ones and young children.

McKinney Real Estate Listings

McKinney real estate listings range from the modest to the grand. You can find 2-bedroom and even 8-bedroom properties, but most listings have 3 to 4 bedrooms and 2 to 4 partial and full bathrooms. The real estate listings in McKinney vary a lot in terms of age. You can find newly constructed homes, those built several decades ago, and everything else in between.

Common features include granite countertops, built-in cabinetry, stainless steel appliances, wrought iron balustrades and fixtures, elegant chandeliers, open floor plans, game rooms, media rooms, California islands, and more.

McKinney is where you can find the Central Park Campus of Collin College. The campus of the Collin Higher Education Center has been here since 2010. The main public school district here is the McKinney ISD, to which nearly two-thirds of all McKinney households are zoned. McKinney Boyd High School is also in the ISD.

The remaining third are zoned to Frisco ISD, Prosper ISD, Allen ISD, Melissa ISD, Lovejoy ISD, and Celina ISD. These maintain fairly impressive national rankings, and they have proven their expertise in educating minds of any age. If you prefer to enroll your child in a private school, you can take them to McKinney Christian Academy or Cornerstone Christian Academy, which both offer K through grade 12.

McKinney Home Values

McKinney home values have been showing relatively good activity recently, especially since the Texas real estate market began its recent boom. The home values in McKinney are even expected to go up a bit more in the coming year, given the low foreclosure and mortgage default rates. Current home values here can be as low as $90,000 and as high as $2 million.

McKinney Real Estate Market

McKinney real estate is remarkably varied. Featured are many different styles of homes ranging from restored historic homes from the turn of the century and before, to modern day wonders of architecture. With such a huge variety of real estate available it is not very difficult to find your perfect home in McKinney.

McKinney Amenities

McKinney also features a great array of choices for entertainment, shopping and recreation. There is a new performing arts center located at the historic Collin County Courthouse that functions as a performing arts venue. The city core features a variety of interesting and curious shops and restaurants, and there is a 296 acre wilderness preserve that showcases the natural beauty of the McKinney area.
